docs.lead_paragraph: UNDER pressure from the state, new federal school wellness guidelines, and mounting concern over child obesity and diabetes rates, schools across the state are making major changes in their lunch lines and vending machines. At the Bielefield Elementary School in Middletown, students are eating low-fat popcorn instead of fried potato chips. In Farmington, water, fruit juices and milk have replaced soda in the high school vending machines. And in Meriden schools, bagels have shrunk from a six-ounce serving to under three ounces.
